an2.180:1.3: Anger and hostility … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.
an2.181-185:1.3: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.
an2.186-190:1.1: “Anyone who has two things lives in suffering.
an2.186-190:1.3: Anger and hostility … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.
an2.186-190:1.4: Anyone who has these two things lives in suffering.”
an2.191-195:1.1: “Anyone who has these two things lives happily.
an2.191-195:1.3: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.
an2.191-195:1.4: Anyone who has these two things lives happily.”
an2.196-200:1.1: “These two things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
an2.196-200:1.3: Anger and hostility … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.
an2.196-200:1.4: These two things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”
an2.201-205:1.1: “These two things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
an2.201-205:1.3: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.
an2.201-205:1.4: These two things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”
an2.206-210:1.1: “Anyone who has two things is cast down to hell.
an2.206-210:1.3: Anger and hostility … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.
an2.206-210:1.4: Anyone who has these two things is cast down to hell.”
an2.211-215:1.1: “Anyone who has two things is raised up to heaven.
an2.211-215:1.3: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.
an2.211-215:1.4: Anyone who has these two things is raised up to heaven.”
an2.216-220:1.1: “When they have two things, some people, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an2.216-220:1.3: Anger and hostility … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.
an2.216-220:1.4: When they have two things, some people, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an2.221-229:1.1: “When they have two things, some people—when their body breaks up, after death—are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an2.221-229:1.3: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.
an2.221-229:1.4: When they have these two things, some people—when their body breaks up, after death—are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
